Articles.Content: **Edited <time datetime="2018-11-09T02:22:02Z" title="11/09/2018 02:22  AM" data-short="5 yr">November 9, 2018</time> by Thingymajigy**
Ok I give up trying to perfect this. 1.0 made it a lot harder to build certain stealth planes that fly well.
Hmm, what appears to be the problem?

Nothing too wrong with it currently except that it doesn't look right. Can't do much about it because stealth designs need wing segments everywhere at odd angles, which with the new aero physics, make performance bad/unstable. The plane's more of a proof of concept of the internal missiles.

Well, it's a balance between aesthetics and performance then.

Does the open cockpit not create massive amounts of drag?
It does slow it down; at sea level, speed caps out at 250m/s and when replaced with an inline cockpit, it goes up to 270. Not the biggest of problems, really.

Do you work for a kerbal company around here? This looks like something out of Sparrowhawk ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

(Not saying you took it or anything, supposedly a compliment)

haha thanks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I'm relatively new to the forums, haven't checked out the companies yet, but Sparrowhawk looks interesting.

yeah it's a good replica not perfect looking but a good compromize between looks and functionality.

You can check Sparrowhawk in my sign just click the image.
